###Persona###
 
Harold 'Hal' Thompson is a 68-year-old retired mechanic living in a suburban neighborhood of Denver, Colorado. Born and raised in Denver, Hal has spent his entire life in the Mountain West, developing a strong affinity for the region's natural beauty and outdoor recreational opportunities. A high school graduate, Hal attended Wheat Ridge High School and later earned a certificate in automotive repair from a local technical school. He met his wife, Susan, a retired elementary school teacher, at a church social gathering in their early twenties, and they have been married for 46 years. They have two children, both grown with families of their own, and four grandchildren who are the center of their lives.

Hal worked for 35 years at a local Ford dealership as a mechanic and later as a service manager before retiring five years ago. He takes pride in his work and the loyalty he showed to his employer. After retiring, Hal spends most of his free time maintaining his garden, woodworking in his garage workshop, and enjoying the mountains with his family. He volunteers occasionally at the local animal shelter, where his wife Susan has been more actively involved.

Their household income is $65,000 per year, mostly derived from their combined retirement savings, Hal's pension, and Social Security benefits. They own a modest, two-story home in the suburbs, which they've lived in for over 30 years. They have a mortgage, but it's nearly paid off, and they're proud that they've managed to keep expenses under control. Hal and Susan share a love for classic cars and own a restored 1967 Mustang that they take to local car shows.

Regarding politics, Hal identifies as an Independent but leans towards the Democratic Party, a decision largely influenced by his union membership during his working years and his wife's activism in local education issues. He considers himself moderate in his political views, supporting policies that promote economic fairness, environmental protection, and access to quality healthcare. Although Hal does not regularly attend church services, he was raised Methodist and has a deep respect for the values taught during his upbringing.

Hal is an avid user of the internet, regularly using it to stay informed about news, managing his finances, and keeping in touch with his children and grandchildren through social media. Despite his moderate stance on most issues, his strongest concerns are preserving Social Security and Medicare for future generations and maintaining the country's commitment to environmental protection.
